You have some other employees, coworkers, that will maybe poke fun at, why do you do all of these things and you're just trying to blah, blah, blah, whatever. No, we do it under the Lord. I wonder this evening, the perspective that we have with regard to the duties that God gives us. And when we find ourselves in a position, even as Joseph found himself in this position in the house of Potiphar, with some events and circumstances that were outside of his control, that he was a man that I believe, as we look at the text of scripture, served cheerfully in. wholeheartedly. Oh, that God would help us. I would tell you this evening, and I think for most of you, I know you well enough that you would tell me as well, that really nothing has happened in my life or in your life that's as bad as what happened to Joseph in Genesis 37. But Joseph still kept a perspective that was God-honoring and allowed him to get in the house of Potiphar and have a shining testimony for the Lord. As we continue studying through Genesis 39, we'll find Joseph not only as the overseer, but we'll see Joseph as the accused. And we'll notice that even in that portion of Scripture, that Joseph kept his eyes on God and Joseph did what was right. This evening, I hope that God would help us to gain this perspective of Joseph as the overseer and take some of these principles and apply them in our lives that we, too, might have the blessing and favor of God upon our lives. Listen, God's blessing and favor doesn't come by accident. It doesn't come by random chance. It comes as we humbly follow the Lord in obedience to His Word. And God's blessing and God's favor is in our lives. Let me say this before we close. Not everything that we look at in life as a blessing is truly a blessing. There are some things that you could look at as a blessing that really could be a curse. And there are some things that you could look at in life that you might think is a curse that's really a blessing. Our ways are not His ways. Amen? His thoughts are not our thoughts. He transcends us. And sometimes if we're not careful, we have the perspective of our society when we're looking at and seeking to evaluate blessings and cursings, but we need to have God's perspective to understand what's taking place. I'm so thankful that our God is a good God. He desires that we'd walk with Him and that we'd serve Him. And He will bless as we walk in obedience to Him. Let's pray together. Father, we love You. We thank You for loving us. We thank You for Your Word. Thank You for the example of Joseph. And as we see Joseph in these first few verses of Genesis 39 as the overseer, we're convicted by the testimony that Joseph has even in the midst of all the circumstances that surround his being in this place. And God, I pray that You'd help us to lift our eyes unto Thee. Lord, help us to have a proper biblical perspective with regard to the place where You have us, to those circumstances that have brought us to the place that we are. Help us, Lord, to serve You. Lord, as unto Christ, not unto men. Help us in our daily work as we find ourselves wherever we find ourselves that what we do is for You, Lord. Help us to have that perspective. Help us, Lord, to live our lives in such a way that Your blessing and Your favor would be upon us. And God, I pray that others would see it. Just as Potiphar observed the life of Joseph and saw that the Lord was with him, I pray that others as they observe our lives would see that there's something different about us and that that difference is Christ. Would You move and work in these moments of invitation? Lord, help us to be doers of the Word and not hearers only. And we'll thank You for it. In Christ's name we pray.
